author: Monica O’Shea
description: The United Firefighters Union is concerned the metro tunnel is unsafe during emergency.
title: Melbourne $15.5 Billion Metro Tunnel Set to Open Early Despite Firefighter Union Safety Concerns

author: Monica O’Shea
description: A survey from the Victorian Chamber of Commerce and Industry and Committee for Melbourne found 76% of businesses provide flexible work arrangements already
title: Victorian Businesses Argue Work From Home Legislation Is Not Needed

author: Carolina Avendano
description: Alberta Premier Danielle Smith says the B.C. premier’s opposition to her B.C. pipeline proposal violates her province’s right to export its resources and blocks a project she says would benefit all of Canada. Smith made the comments on Oct. 7, responding to remarks B.C. Premier David Eby made the previous day, where he described Alberta’s […]
title: Alberta’s Smith Calls Eby’s Opposition to BC Coast Pipeline Pitch ‘Un-Canadian and Unconstitutional’

author: Paul Rowan Brian
description: Canada-U.S. Trade Minister Dominic LeBlanc says there has been “substantial progress” made in trade talks with the United States, following a meeting between Prime Minister Mark Carney and U.S. President Donald Trump at the White House. Although no trade deal has yet been reached between Washington and Ottawa, LeBlanc said that more progress has been […]
title: No Deal but ‘Substantial Progress’ Made in Trump Talks: Minister LeBlanc

author: Andrew Thornebrooke
description: The CCP is engaged in a decades-long campaign of territorial expansion designed to prevent the U.S. from entering into direct conflict with it, experts said.
title: China Engaged in Illegal Territorial Expansion, Congress Hears

author: Noé Chartier
description: News Analysis Prime Minister Mark Carney visited the White House to meet with U.S. President Donald Trump for the second occasion in five months, and this time around there was more optimism in the air. Whether intentionally or not, the officials speaking anonymously to the media ahead of the meeting had created an atmosphere of […]
title: 5 Takeaways From Carney’s 2nd Trump Meeting at White House

author: Epoch Times Staff
description: A glimpse into the world through the lens of photography.
title: Day in Photos: Anniversary of Oct. 7 Attack, Mayor Injured in Germany, and Nobel Prize in Physics

author: Olivia Gomm
description: A representative of the movement to flood federal election ballots with candidates as a way to advocate for electoral reform defended his actions before a House of Commons committee on Oct. 7. Tomas Szuchewycz told MPs the Longest Ballot Committee (LBC) urges MPs to recuse themselves from writing election rules, which he calls a conflict […]
title: Man Behind Hundreds of Candidates Flooding Poilievre’s Elections Defends Action at House Committee

author: Jennifer Cowan
description: Ontario has announced plans to provide patients with early access to select new cancer medications as part of a pilot project that will make the drugs available even if public health hasn’t completed price negotiations with the pharmaceutical companies. Deputy premier and Health Minister Sylvia Jones said the Funding Accelerated for Specific Treatments (FAST) program […]
title: Ontario Launches Pilot to Give Patients Early Access to Select New Cancer Drugs

author: Chandra Philip
description: Concordia University has closed its downtown Montreal campus, citing concerns expressed by its president about “extreme disruption” related to planned protests on the second anniversary of the Hamas attacks on Israel. Hamas killed roughly 1,200 people and took 251 hostages in its raids inside Israel on Oct. 7, 2023. Israel announced military operations in Gaza […]
title: Concordia Closes Montreal Campus Over Concerns of ‘Disruption’ by Pro-Palestinian Protests on Oct. 7 Attack Anniversary

author: Paul Rowan Brian
description: Prime Minister Mark Carney says Canada is prepared to invest $1 trillion in the United States if Ottawa receives the trade deal it hopes for with Washington. Carney made the remarks during an Oct. 7 visit to the White House to meet with U.S. President Donald Trump, where the two leaders said they would discuss […]
title: Carney Says Canada Could Invest $1 Trillion in US as Part of Deal With Trump

author: Zachary Stieber
description: The report detailed how Ukrainian officials were surprised by then-Vice President Joe Biden's actions when he was in Ukraine in 2015.
title: Biden ‘Strongly’ Preferred CIA to Not Distribute Sensitive Ukraine Report, Declassified Records Show

author: Jennifer Cowan
description: Economic uncertainty caused by U.S. President Donald Trump’s tariffs on Canada took centre stage at a recent three-day summit of Great Lakes governors and premiers in Quebec City. Quebec Premier François Legault and Ontario Premier Doug Ford were joined by Pennsylvania Governor Josh Shapiro, and Wisconsin Governor Tony Evers at the Great Lakes St. Lawrence […]
title: Great Lakes Premiers and Governors Focus on Tariff-Induced Economic Uncertainty at Summit

author: Frank Fang
description: 'I cannot believe that I didn't know anything about this until today,' one audience member stated. 'How do we get this film out?'
title: Film on China’s Illicit Organ Trade Sparks Concerns Among DC Audience

description: 'I cannot believe that I didn't know anything about this until today,' one audience member stated. 'How do we get this film out?'

description: As both Trump and Canadian Prime Minister Mark Carney sought to ease trade tensions, Trump said the Canadian delegation would leave the meeting 'very happy.'
title: Touting Potential Deal, Trump Says Canadians Will ‘Love Us Again’

author: Guy Birchall
description: An impasse in the Senate has once again forced Washington into shutdown, but why does this occurrence not afflict other nations?
title: Why Don’t Other Countries Shut Down Like the United States?

author: The Canadian Press
description: More public service workers in British Columbia are off the job as the union increases pressure to get a new contract. The B.C. General Employees’ Union says it has added 48 work sites to the picket list, with another 2,600 workers taking part in strike action. The additional pickets are at 18 provincial liquor and […]
title: Striking BC Public Service Workers Expand Pickets Again to More Liquor Stores

author: Matthew Horwood
description: OTTAWA—Freedom Convoy co-organizer Tamara Lich has been given a conditional sentence of 18 months, with credit given for time served. Justice Heather Perkins-McVey ruled on Oct. 7 that Lich will be under house arrest for the first 12 months, with exceptions for court appearances, medical emergencies, employment, religious services, and a “period of up to […]
title: Tamara Lich Handed Conditional Sentence Over Freedom Convoy Role

author: Adam Morrow
description: Syria held its first election since the Assad regime was overthrown last December.
title: Initial Results of Syria Parliament Poll Suggest Few Wins for Women, Christians, Minorities

author: Matthew Horwood
description: OTTAWA—Freedom Convoy co-organizer Chris Barber has been given a conditional sentence of 18 months and a three-month concurrent conditional sentence for his role in the protest, which will be served in the community under house arrest. Justice Heather Perkins-McVey ruled on Oct. 7 that Barber will also be required to serve 100 hours of community […]
title: Freedom Convoy Organizer Barber Given Conditional Sentence, No Jail Time

author: Olivia Gomm
description: Canada’s merchandise trade deficit grew to $6.32 billion in August from $3.8 billion in July as exports fell faster than the increase in imports, new data from Statistics Canada says. International exports declined by 3 percent in August, representing the first drop since April, with exports to the United States and other major trading partners […]
title: Canada’s Trade Deficit Reaches $6.32B in August as Exports Decline: StatCan

author: Victoria Friedman
description: The Treasury Department says that Los Chapitos has 'consistently procured precursor chemicals, overseen illicit laboratories, and managed drug distribution.'
title: Treasury Sanctions Mexican Companies Accused of Aiding Cartel Fentanyl Production

author: Matthew Horwood
description: The federal government has announced that it will be breaking with its tradition of introducing budgets in the springtime, instead introducing them in the fall going forward. Finance Minister François-Philippe Champagne made the announcement on Oct. 6. While Conservatives have been critical of the government for not introducing a spring budget in 2025, and for […]
title: What’s Behind Ottawa Introducing Budgets in the Fall From Now On

author: Jennifer Cowan
description: Premier Doug Ford says he will ban Crown Royal whiskey from Ontario-run liquor stores if British alcoholic beverage company Diageo proceeds with its plan to close its bottling plant in the southwestern part of the province. Ford has been critical of Diageo since the company announced plans in late August to shutter its nearly 100-year-old […]
title: Ford Vows to Pull Crown Royal From LCBO if Diageo Shutters Ontario Plant

author: The Canadian Press
description: Vancouver-based Trilogy Metals Inc. says the U.S. government will take a 10-percent stake in the mineral exploration company, which has mining interests in Alaska that Washington wants to see developed. The U.S. government is spending US$35.6 million on the stake, and has options to increase it further in the future. The transaction remains subject to […]
title: US Government to Take 10 Percent Stake in Canadian Mining Company Trilogy Metals

author: Chris Summers
description: British Prime Minister Keir Starmer's spokesperson said the previous government referred to China as an 'epoch-defining challenge' but not an enemy.
title: UK Government Denies It’s to Blame for Collapse of China Spies Trial

author: Aldgra Fredly
description: The president said he wants Ukraine to answer some questions about how it would use the weapons before finalizing his decision.
title: Trump Says He Has Pretty Much Made a Decision on Tomahawk Supply to Ukraine

description: The IEA report stated that renewables are expected to surpass coal at the end of 2025.

description: Jewish and pro-Palestinian groups mark two years since Hamas attacks as Albanese, Marles, and Ley call for reflection and restraint.

description: Washington’s 20-point plan calls for a ceasefire, aid and reconstruction in Gaza, and the release of hostages.

author: The Associated Press
description: TIRANA, Albania—A judge at the Tirana appeals court was shot dead on Monday by a man involved in a trial, police in Albania said. The gunman fled the scene but was later arrested. Judge Astrit Kalaja was shot inside the courtroom by a 30-year-old suspect with the initials E. Sh., according to police. Kalaja died […]
title: Judge Shot Dead in Albania Courtroom, With Gunman Arrested After Running Away

author: Reuters
description: JAKARTA—Indonesian rescuers wrapped up the search on Tuesday for victims trapped under the rubble of a collapsed Islamic boarding school in the province of East Java, after retrieving more than 60 bodies, disaster authorities said. Grief and confusion gripped the small town of Sidoarjo last week after foundational failures caused the Al Khoziny school to […]
title: Indonesia Ends Search for Victims of Boarding School Collapse, 61 Dead

author: PA Media
description: Amber weather warnings are in place for parts of western Scotland and Northern Ireland as Storm Amy lands in the UK. Heavy rain and strong winds of up to 100mph are expected in exposed coastal areas on Friday evening. The weather system, which is the first named storm of the season, will also bring wet […]
title: Amber Warnings in Place for Winds up to 100Mph as Storm Amy Sweeps In

author: PA Media
description: A man has been seriously injured and more than 184,000 homes and businesses left without power as Storm Amy battered the island of Ireland. The storm also brought localised flooding, fallen trees, transport disruption and school closures in Northern Ireland. The Republic of Ireland’s forecasting agency issued its highest-level wind warning in Co Donegal, where […]
title: Man Seriously Injured and 184,000 Without Power as Storm Amy Batters Ireland

author: PA Media
description: Around one in six people on universal credit in Britain are estimated to be foreign nationals, although this includes EU citizens who had settled long-term in the country before Brexit. Shadow chancellor Sir Mel Stride announced on Monday that the Conservatives would restrict benefits to UK citizens if the party wins the next general election, […]
title: How Many Foreign Nationals Receive Benefits in the UK?

author: PA Media
description: Hopeful homebuyers and sellers will gain further evidence of how the autumn housing market is progressing amid uncertainty about a potential property tax shake-up in the Budget. Halifax will release its September house price report on Tuesday October 7, with the Royal Institution of Chartered Surveyors (Rics) housing market report for the same month following […]
title: Housing Data to Shed Light on Market Amid Pre-Budget Buyer ‘Hesitation’

author: PA Media
description: Aston Martin Lagonda has warned it expects to tumble into the red amid US tariff woes and flagged fears over supply chain pressures from Jaguar Land Rover’s cyber attack fallout. The luxury carmaker said it is now braced for underlying losses greater than £110 million, which was the bottom of the previous expected range, marking […]
title: Aston Martin Set to Slump to a Loss as US Tariff Impact Bites

author: PA Media
description: A slowdown across the UK’s construction sector eased last month as housebuilding activity picked up pace, despite facing the longest stretch of job cutting since the pandemic, a new survey shows. The latest S&P Global UK construction purchasing managers’ index (PMI) showed a reading of 46.2 in September, up from 45.5 in August and its […]
title: UK’s Construction Slump Eases Despite Prolonged Stretch of Job Cutting

author: PA Media
description: The funeral of the first victim of the Manchester synagogue terror attack has taken place as the shocked community struggles to come to terms with the deaths of two “brave” men. Mourners paid tribute to Melvin Cravitz, 66, from Crumpsall, who died after he helped to prevent Jihad Al-Shamie from entering the Heaton Park Hebrew Congregation […]
title: Bravery of Synagogue Attack Victims Remembered as First Funeral Takes Place

author: PA Media
description: The Conservatives will abolish business rates for high street shops and pubs if they win the next election, the shadow chancellor has promised. Sir Mel Stride made the commitment as he addressed the Conservative Party conference on Monday, saying the “burden of Labour’s tax rises” had been “simply too much to bear” for many businesses. […]
title: Tories Pledge to Scrap Business Rates for Shops and Pubs

author: Naziya Alvi Rahman
description: In another incident in Sydney, a man was questioned after allegedly pointing a firearm from a moving truck at a synagogue.
title: Police Probe Pro-Hamas Graffiti on Melbourne Billboard

description: The Venezuelan leader said that local right-wing extremists aimed to trigger conflict between the two nations.

description: Support for U.S. President Donald Trump's peace plan is growing in the Middle East, according to a man whose wife and three children were taken hostage.
title: On 2nd Anniversary of Oct. 7 Attack, Israeli Families Express Optimism for Peace

author: Rex Widerstrom
description: The HMNZS Manawanui ran aground on a reef in October last year after no one onboard could switch off the autopilot.
title: New Zealand to Pay Samoa $6 Million Over Navy Ship Grounding

description: The country's defence ministers have unveiled a plan to make global suppliers work with NZ companies, and to set up a Technology Accelerator.
title: New Zealand Plans to Boost Defence Manufacturing, Eyes Equipment and Tech Exports

description: Liberal Senator Michaelia Cash has asked the Labor government to confirm or deny the presence of ISIS brides and their children in Australia.
title: Official Tight-Lipped on Whether 2 ‘ISIS Brides’ Are Back in Australia: Estimates

author: Carolina Avendano
description: The trial of a former Hydro-Québec employee accused of economic espionage for Beijing has been postponed by a day after the utility requested certain corporate information be kept confidential. The trial for Yuesheng Wang, 38, a former Hydro-Québec employee, was scheduled to begin on Oct. 6, but Quebec Court Judge Jean-Philippe Marcoux postponed the proceedings […]
title: Trial Delayed for Ex–Hydro-Québec Employee Accused of Spying for China as Utility Seeks to Protect Sensitive Data

description: The bill mandates real-time outage reporting, new performance standards, and stronger ACMA powers to prevent emergency call failures.
title: New Laws to Strengthen 000 Reliability and Hold Telcos to Account

description: Senator Andrew Bragg hints at the Liberal Party's ability to handle large migration levels amid housing crises.
title: Migration Just 1 Factor in Complex Housing Crisis Dynamic: Senator

author: PA Media
description: A firearms officer fatally shot a 28-year-old during a foiled prison break, despite being able to see his empty hand and no sign of a weapon, a misconduct hearing has been told. The officer, known only as W80, shot Jermaine Baker, from Tottenham, north London, as police stopped a plot to snatch two prisoners from […]
title: Met Marksman Faces Misconduct Hearing for 2015 Shooting of Unarmed Man

author: The Associated Press
description: STOCKHOLM—Three scientists won the Nobel Prize in medicine Monday for discoveries about how the immune system knows to attack germs and not our own bodies. The work by Mary E. Brunkow, Fred Ramsdell and Dr. Shimon Sakaguchi uncovered a key pathway the body uses to keep the immune system in check, called peripheral immune tolerance. […]
title: Nobel Prize in Medicine Goes to 3 Scientists for Key Immune System Discoveries

author: Naziya Alvi Rahman
description: April Palmerlee says US–Australia creative ties will remain strong despite new trade move.
title: American Chamber of Commerce Confident US–Australia Film Links Will Withstand Trump Tariff

author: Paul Rowan Brian
description: B.C. Premier David Eby is doubling down on his opposition to a pipeline proposal being prepared by Alberta, saying it’s a “fictional” project that is trying to use “wedge politics” and what he calls a Donald Trump style of politics for leverage. Alberta Premier Danielle Smith said on Oct. 1 that her province will put […]
title: BC Premier Suggests Alberta’s Proposed Pipeline Project a Trump-Style Tactic for Political Gain

author: Paul Rowan Brian
description: U.S. President Donald Trump says he expects his Canadian counterpart to bring up tariffs as Prime Minister Mark Carney is set to visit the White House on Oct. 7. Trump made the comments the day ahead of the meeting, saying that an increasing number of Canadian companies are relocating to the United States thanks to […]
title: Trump Says Companies Leaving Canada for US, Expects Carney to Bring Up Tariffs During Visit

author: Olivia Gomm
description: Three individuals have been arrested and are facing charges in connection with a March shooting in Surrey, B.C., which police say could be related to an extortion investigation. A residence in the 13300 block of 89A Avenue in Surrey was damaged by several gunshots around 1:55 a.m. on March 27, the Surrey Police Service (SPS) […]
title: BC Police Charge 3 Individuals in Connection With Extortion-Related Surrey Shooting
